sky: the space above the earth that you can see when you look up, where clouds and the sun, moon and stars appear
wild: living or growing in natural conditions; not kept in a house or on a farm
baby: a very young child or animal
nature: all the plants, animals and things that exist in the universe that are not made by people
jump: to move quickly off the ground or away from a surface by pushing yourself with your legs and feet
possibility: a thing that may happen or be true; the fact that something might happen or be true, but is not certain
move on: to start doing or discussing something new
control: the power to make decisions about how a country, an area, an organization, etc.
rare: not done, seen, happening, etc. very often
interest: the feeling that you have when you want to know or learn more about somebody/something
blue: having the colour of a clear sky or the sea on a clear day
ink: coloured liquid for writing, drawing and printing
vacation: a period of time spent travelling or resting away from home
apple: a round fruit with shiny red or green skin that is fairly hard and white inside
easel: a wooden frame to hold a picture while it is being painted
love: a very strong feeling of liking and caring for somebody/something, especially a member of your family or a friend
observation: the act of watching somebody/something carefully for a period of time, especially to learn something
card: thick, stiff paper; a piece of this for writing on
brush: an object made of short stiff hairs (called bristles) or wires set in a block of wood or plastic, usually attached to a handle. Brushes are used for many different jobs, such as cleaning, painting and tidying your hair.
dog: an animal with four legs and a tail, often kept as a pet or trained for work, for example hunting or guarding buildings.
little: not big; small; smaller than others
